page.title: 04The Ghost Of Tower Grange
page.content:
Trying to hide because of what I am, Locked away from the outside world. Will the Queen change her mind? I wonder if the guards will find me. I hear the call, to hide in my hole. The moment I have been dreading... The bolt on the door slides out of place, The horrified look on my friend's face As the Queen's men slowly kill him, For trying to hide me away from them, I hide in a corner, They chain me up and leave me to die and rot away, To haunt this place for ever.
by Kate Brazier (aged 11)
{* Tower Grange,}built in 1350, is reputed to have the ghost of a priest who died in a priest hole in Elizabethan times.
